columns.text: In this problem, we are asked to determine the company's current share price.

From the exercise, we can see that our company is expected to grow in two distinct stages. In the first stage (first three years) dividend is expected to grow at a rate of 30 percent. Also, the dividend is expected to grow at a rate of 4 percent in the second growth stage (after the third year). For the determination of the share price we will use the **two-stage growth** valuation formula:

$$\begin{aligned} \text{P}_\text{0} &=\dfrac{{\text{D}_\text{1}}}{\text{R}-\text{g}_\text{1}}\times\left[1-\left(\dfrac{1+\text{g}_1}{1+\text{R}} \right)^\text{t}\right]+\dfrac{\text{P}_\text{t}}{\left(1+\text{R}\right)^\text{t}} \\\end{aligned}$$
Where:

$\text{D}_1$ = First Period Dividend\
$\text{P}_\text{t}$ = Stock Price at Time t\
$\text{g}_1$ = First Stage Growth Rate\
R = Required Return\
t = Time

In previous formula, we have variable $\text{P}_\text{t}$ which represents stock price at time t. It can be calculated as follows:
$$\begin{aligned} \text{P}_\text{t} &=\dfrac{\text{D}_0\times\left(1+\text{g}_1\right)^\text{t}\times\left(1+\text{g}_2\right)}{\text{R}-\text{g}_2}\\ \end{aligned}$$

Where:

$\text{D}_0$ = Current Dividend\
$\text{g}_2$ = Second Stage Growth Rate

Let's first identify the given information in the problem:
| Variables| Values| 
|--|--| 
|First Stage Growth Rate |$\hspace{3pt}$ 30% | 
|Time   | $\hspace{7pt}$ 3| 
|Second Stage Growth Rate |$\hspace{5pt}$ 4% | 
|Required Return  |$\hspace{2pt}$ 11% | 
|Current Dividend|$2.45 |

First, we have to determine stock price at the year three in order to plug it into formula for stock price. For such calculation all inputs are given except first period dividend. This dividend can be determined on the basis of following formula:

$$\begin{aligned} 
\text{D}_1 &=\text{D}_0\times\left(1+\text{g}\right) 
 \end{aligned}$$

We should use growth rate $\text{g}_1$ for calculation of the first year dividend, since this dividend comes from the first stage of a company's growth. So we have:

$$\begin{aligned} 
\text{D}_1 &=\text{D}_0\times\left(1+\text{g}\right) \\[15pt]
&=2.45\times\left(1+0.30\right) \\[15pt]
&=2.45\times1.3\\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\bf\$3.1850}
 \end{aligned}$$

**Dividend from the first year is $3.185.**

Next, we can proceed with the determination of the stock price at year three, which is needed for the calculation of the current share price.

$$\begin{aligned} \text{P}_3 
&=\dfrac{\text{D}_0\times\left(1+\text{g}_1\right)^\text{t}\times\left(1+\text{g}_2\right)}{\text{R}-\text{g}_2}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{$2.45\times\left(1+0.3\right)^3\times\left(1+0.04\right)$}}{0.11-0.04}\\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{$2.45\times2.1970\times1.04$}}{0.07}\\[15pt]
&= \dfrac{\text{5.597956
}}{0.07}\\[15pt]
&= \boxed{\bf\$79.9708}
\\
\end{aligned}$$

**Stock price at year three is $79.9708.**

Now, current stock price can be determined:
$$\begin{aligned} \text{P}_0 &=\dfrac{\text{D}_1}{\text{R}-\text{g}_1}\times\left[1-\left(\dfrac{1+\text{g}_1}{1+\text{R}} \right)^\text{t}\right]+\dfrac{\text{P}_3}{\left(1+\text{R}\right)^\text{t}} \\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{3.1850}}{0.11-0.30}\times\left[1-\left(\dfrac{1+0.30}{1+0.11} \right)^3\right]+\dfrac{79.9708}{\left(1+0.11\right)^3} \\[15pt]
&=\dfrac{\text{3.1850}}{0.11-0.30}\times\left[1-1.60642746
\right]+\dfrac{79.9708}{1.36763100} \\[15pt]
&=\left(-16.76315789\right)\times\left(-0.60642746\right)+58.47395972
 \\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\bf\$68.64}
\end{aligned}$$

**Current share price is $68.64.**
